etymologies: mid 16th century. From post-classical Latin disclamation-, disclamatio disclaimer, renunciation from disclamat-, past participial stem of disclamare + classical Latin -iō

definitions: The disavowal or repudiation of a vassal's obligations to a superior; an instance of this.

notes.text: In English law referred to as disclaimer.

definitions: The action of disclaiming; renunciation, repudiation, denial; an instance of this.
